resources.string: PCAPdroid is an open source network capture and monitoring tool which works without root privileges
Check out the user guide to learn how to access the paid features
The %1$s app has been blocked by the firewall

With the integrated Firewall" you can easily block Internet access to individual apps and domains
Combine this with the built-in traffic visibility to get the ultimate tool to protect your privacy"

"PCAPdroid can query a local database to determine the country of a remote server
You must first download the geolocation database from the app settings"

Enhance the security of your device with the malware detection" feature
By using up-to-date blacklists, it can detect, block and alert malicious connections in real-time"

"The app does not employ any tracking, analytics or phoning-home anti-features
How can you be sure? Check out its "privacy policy and its source code

PCAPdroid provides multiple ways" to dump the traffic in the standard PCAP format for further analysis
Via the "trailer option, you can add app names to the packets and display them in Wireshark

"Inspecting HTTP requests, responses and raw data is easy, thanks to the built-in decoders
Got an encrypted connection? You can enable the "TLS decryption to get the decrypted data

"PCAPdroid is a privacy-friendly app which lets you track and analyze the connections made by the apps in your device
Moreover, it allows you to export a PCAP dump of the traffic, extract metadata and much more!"

PCAPdroid is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License or later for more details
The connection to Google Play is in progress, please retry in a while
Could not connect to Google Play. Please retry in a while
Detect and possibly block private DNS to inspect DNS traffic. Disabling this can hinder traffic analysis
Block QUIC connections to possibly fall back to decryptable TLS. Some apps may stop working

"An error occurred while exporting the CA certificate
If your device implements Autostart or similar software to limit background services execution, be sure to "whitelist PCAPdroid
You can now use the purchased feature
Capture the traffic of all the apps
Could not open the capture interface
Certificate exported, now install it from the Android settings
The CA certificate is not installed, run the mitm setup wizard
This connection has been blocked by PCAPdroid
Could not find the given connection
PCAPdroid has not seen the start of this connection. Some information may be missing
Check which apps are allowed to control the PCAPdroid capture
"An app wants to capture your device traffic. Deny it if you are not sure"
PCAPdroid: the control request was allowed
PCAPdroid: the control request was denied
"An unexpected error occurred. Sorry for the inconvenience."
This connection will not be decrypted. Create a decryption rule to decrypt it
Select a target app or use the decryption whitelist when decrypting TLS to avoid losing your connection to the Internet
These rules specify which connections to decrypt. Host-based rules only work if a prior DNS reply is seen
Continuing will disconnect the active VPN
Configure the DNS servers to use during the capture
Redirect all the TCP connections to a SOCKS5 proxy
Export the PCAPdroid CA certificate, then open the Android \"Encryption & Credentials\" settings and choose install it as a \"CA certificate\"
The external storage permission is required
This feature is currently unavailable for your device
Buy the %1$s feature to start blocking connections
Block internet access to apps, configure rules for specific domains and IP addresses. Only works with the non-root capture
These rules specify which connections to allow. Blocklist rules have priority over whitelist rules
In this mode all the connections will be blocked, unless manually whitelisted. You may miss push notifications without a proper whitelist
The full payload option has been disabled
"Show the full connections payload (e.g. the full HTTP request and response). This requires a lot of memory, don't use in the long run"
Tap to delete the database and save space
Tap to download the latest database. New databases are available monthly
Database not found. Geolocation is disabled
Show country and ASN info by performing offline lookups
Give PCAPdroid the permission to control the mitm addon
List of rules to hide connection-list entries so you can focus on relevant ones
Start an HTTP server for the PCAP download
Install the PCAPdroid CA certificate, choosing \"VPN and apps\". Android will ask for your lockscreen or password
You have reached the licenses limit for this unlock token. Buy a new token to generate more licenses
The PCAPdroid license service is currently unavailable. Please retry in some minutes
The app is running out of memory, expect crashes
Learn more about the malware detection feature
Detect connections to known malicious hosts via third-party blacklists
User-defined whitelist to inhibit malware detection. Long-press malicious connections to create rules unmarking them as malware
You are trying to import many rules, which could make the app unresponsive during some interactions. Do you really want to continue?
Switch to clock mode for the time input.
Switch to text input mode for the time input.
Connection to the mitm addon failed. As a workaround, you can try to open the mitm addon app and then go back to PCAPdroid without closing it. Do you want to open it now?
Bad PCAPdroid mitm addon version. Please install version %1$s and retry
Error while starting the mitm addon. Check the log for details
The PCAPdroid mitm addon must be upgraded

"PCAPdroid is now ready to decrypt the TLS traffic
Check out the "user guide to know more about the security measures which may prevent decryption and how to bypass them
This wizard will guide you through the installation of the PCAPdroid mitm addon and certification authority, which are needed to perform the TLS decryption
The mitm certificate does not seem to be installed. If you proceed, decryption may fail
Could not start the mitm service. Try to open the mitm addon app manually and retry
Configure the device for the TLS decryption
Start date selection: %1$s – End date selection: %2$s
Tap to switch to Calendar view
Tap to switch to year view
The system daemon performing the DNS resolutions
This connection was initiated by netd so it could not be blocked
No app found to handle file selection
No app found to perform this action
The app uses notifications to send alerts in case of anomalous events. Grant it the permission to send notifications in the next screen

Open Source Licenses:
"
- zdtun: "LGPL-3.0"
- nDPI: "LGPL-3.0"
- CustomActivityOnCrash: "Apache-2.0"
- Gson: "Apache-2.0"
- Brotli decoder: "MIT"
- mitmproxy: "MIT"
- Chaquopy: "MIT"
- MaxMind DB Reader: "Apache-2.0"
- FlagKit: "MIT"
- IP Geolocation by "DB-IP"
- AppIntro: "Apache-2.0"
- Font Awesome: "Licenses"
- App icon by "Freepik from flaticon"
- SourceCodePro font: "OFL-1.1"
"
Paid features unlocked. Restart the capture if running

"This view may contain sensitive information, like your passwords and access tokens.
Never give out this information to anyone, it may be a scam attempt"
Payload is truncated. To show it in full, stop the capture and enable \"%1$s\" from the PCAPdroid settings
Create a PCAP file in device storage
The specified PCAP file does not exist
PCAP file loading in progress, please wait
To show the actual apps instead of \"%1$s\", be sure to enable the \"%2$s\" option before exporting the PCAP file
A trailer containing additional metadata (such as the app name) will be added to the dumped packets
Dump packets in the pcapng dump format, which allows embedding TLS decryption secrets
Please complete your transaction to redeem this feature
Configure port mapping rules to redirect connections to a different host or port
Private DNS prevents PCAPdroid from inspecting the DNS traffic. You can turn it off from the Android network settings
QR code expired. Generate a new QR code and retry
Install PCAPdroid from Google Play and scan this QR code
Do you want to generate a license for the \"%1$s\" device using the following unlock token?
Purchase an unlock token to proceed with the QR code activation

"You have configured PCAPdroid to send traffic to a remote server. The server will be able to access your sensitive information.
If someone asked you to do this, it is probably a scam attempt"
For security reasons, sending traffic to the remote server \"%1$s\" is not allowed
Requesting a license code, please wait
Requesting an unlock token, please wait
Do you really want to reset these stats?
System daemons running with maximum privileges
Capture start failure. Make sure you grant root access to PCAPdroid
Capture start failure. Ensure that the device is rooted with Magisk
Allows PCAPdroid to run with other VPN apps
Authenticate to the proxy via username and password
Configure the redirection to a SOCKS5 proxy
TLS decryption is only applied to connections that match the configured rules. Do you want to create decryption rules now?
Decrypt the SSL/TLS traffic by performing mitm. This may now work with some apps, check out the user guide

"The ability to run TLS decryption with root is an experimental feature. This is a list of known bugs:
- in PCAPdroid you will see the traffic as it was generated from the mitm-addon app in place of the original app - when an app filter is set, decryption will only occur for the target app, but PCAPdroid will still show the other apps traffic - if the capture fails to start, ensure that you can actually run the iptables command as root (e.g. via termux) - this may not work on Android 12 and later - if a VPN app is running, you should either target a specific app for decryption or exclude the PCAPdroid mitm addon from the VPN, otherwise traffic will go in a loop"
How to display the trailer data in Wireshark
Sends the PCAP to a remote UDP receiver
\"Unknown\" marks connections whose app could not be determined
This is your unlock token. Note it down as you will need it to generate your license codes
A token which can be used to unlock the paid features in non-Google-Play builds of the app (e.g. F-Droid/Github)
PCAP file has an unsupported datalink
Use the system DNS servers if possible
Exempt some apps from the VPN connection. Their traffic will not be monitored

"To prevent apps from accessing the Internet when PCAPdroid is not running (e.g. after a reboot) you can set PCAPdroid as an always-on VPN in lockdown mode.
Do you want to open the VPN settings now?"
Could not set up the VPN. Ensure that Always-on VPN is disabled

"PCAPdroid simulates a VPN in order to capture the network traffic without root.
To start the capture, you need to accept the VPN request in the next screen.
"NOTE: to proceed, disable any configured Always-on VPN from the Android settings
No application data has been exchanged
Write to external storage failed. Check the app log for details
